admixtools 0.1.0

Compute the fit of an admixturegraph.

qpgraph_slim.Rd

Computes the fit of an admixture graph for a given graph topology given f3 estimates and an inverted covariance matrix.

qpgraph_slim(graph, f3_jest, ppinv, fnscale = 1e-06, numstart = 10,
  seed = NULL, verbose = FALSE, cpp = TRUE)

Arguments

graph

an admixture graph represented as an igraph object
f3_jest

matrix of f3 estimates. output of qpgraph_precompute_f3
ppinv

inverted covariance matrix of f3-statistics
fnscale

try increasing or decreasing this, if optimization does not converge.
numstart

number of random initializations. defaults to 10 times the number of admixture nodes.
seed

seed for generating starting weights.
verbose

print optimization iterations
cpp

should optimization be run in C++ or in R? C++ is faster.
fudge

try increasing this, if you get the error message constraints are inconsistent, no solution!.

Value

a list of qpGraph output data

See also

qpgraph_wrapperfor a wrapper functions which call the original qpGraph program; qpgraph for a slower function which requires f2 block jackknife statistics as input instead. qpgraph_precompute_f3 computes the required input from a 3d array of f2_statistics

Examples

pops = get_leafnames(example_igraph)
precomp = qpgraph_precompute_f3(pops, example_f2_blocks)
#> Error in get_f2(f2_data, pops, f2_denom): !is.character(f2_data) || dir.exists(f2_data) is not TRUE
f3_jest = precomp$f3_jest
#> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'precomp' not found
ppinv = precomp$ppinv
#> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'precomp' not found
out = qpgraph_slim(example_igraph, f3_jest, ppinv)
#> Error in qpgraph_slim(example_igraph, f3_jest, ppinv): object 'f3_jest' not found
plot_graph(out$edges)
#> Error in plot_graph(out$edges): object 'out' not found
